issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The described issue is not actually a problem - it is as designed.
resolution.name: Not A Problem

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Disk space was 100% full. We stopped Tomcat, freed space on the disk, and tried to start tomcat after that. We have activemq broker configuration in a spring beans configuration file. The broker service should be able to start when spring configuration file is loaded but it giving the following error:

Failed to start ActiveMQ JMS Message Broker. Reason: org.apache.activemq.protobuf.InvalidProtocolBufferException: Protocol message contained an invalid tag (zero).

fields.summary: Unable to start broker after KahaDB crash

comments.body: Will deleting the db.data file help?

Actually this happened today again and there was plenty of space on the disk. Is there any way to recover the data? The only thing that I observed was that the db.data file was about 1.15 GB. Is that normal?

you need, kahadb options: checksumJournalFiles and checkForCorruptJournalFiles and ignoreMissingJournalfiles as it appears that your journal is corrupt rather than the index (db.data).
see: http://activemq.apache.org/kahadb.html

Solution available for recovering from this problem:
http://activemq.apache.org/kahadb.html
Thanks Timothy. I am just wondering why these options are not set to true by default if it is so critical.
